scenarioDescription:
The HD 133131 B Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 133131 B is a star with 0.93 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 167.32 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 9.7 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 133131 B is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 133131 B system


HD 133131 B b

HD 133131 B b was discovered by the Las Campanas Observatory observatory, in 2016-12, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 6.15 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 133131 B b is 795.000 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 133131 B b is 13.300 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 133131 B b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 133131 B, which contains 3 exoplanets and was discovered by the Las Campanas Observatory.
name: HD 133131 B - System With 3 Exoplanets
